website_summaries.verdict: An impressive electric die grinder with a fourth-inch collet that functions at 25,000 RPM with no load.
pros: Makita's corded electric die grinder is sizable but still light, weighing only 3.7 pounds
The ergonomic handle is designed for greater comfort when using the tool for extended periods of time
This die grinder features a one-year limited warranty
cons: This tool has a fixed speed, meaning there is no variable control
It is either on or off

customer_reviews.title: Misleading, not a variable
customer_reviews.text: Says it is a variable speed die grinder and it's not. Says it comes with a case and it doesn't. Feeling seriously misled!
customer_reviews.author: Nicole A Moore

customer_reviews.title: How do I not have one of these already??
customer_reviews.text: I use this in conjunction with the saburr carbide burr bits for the purpose of wood carving with modern technology. You do need wrenches to swap bits but not a big deal. I haven't had any of the problems others have noted. I'd rather it not come out anyway. Not to heavy either. I have big hands and I hold it like a pencil or rotary shaft tool many of the times. This can be very dangerous as this tool doesn't come with a guard.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Powerful and high quality
customer_reviews.text: There is nothing bad about this tool. I read reviews on cheaper die grinders and was afraid they would die on me or not be powerful enough. I only needed this tool for a few things but I wanted something that would work. I'm so happy I went with the more expensive choice. I bought some cheap grinding stones and some carbide bits and this thing cuts through anything like butter. Do yourself a favor and get a full face shield.
customer_reviews.author: Nate

customer_reviews.title: Features are wrong.
customer_reviews.text: Product works but features listed are wrong. This is not a variable speed tool. It is either on or off. There is also no case which is listed as included. It comes in a cardboard box. That is not a case. Every makita I own had come with a blow moulded case. This should and doesn't.
customer_reviews.author: brendon.t

customer_reviews.title: I never ever over spend
customer_reviews.text: I love this bit grinder its got to be the best and it is really strong too . oh and it comes with 2 really good flat wrenches for fighting your bits . I would recommend this to everybody its the best and its electric so you do not have to have a compressor either . and at $106 its a pretty good deal to
customer_reviews.author: Douglas H.

customer_reviews.title: Failing after little use.
customer_reviews.text: It feels like a quality, well-built tool, however, mine is failing. It won't rev up to speed and has a noise and vibration. Feels like a bearing or a brush problem. I have had it less than two years and used only a handful of times. Really wanted to buy the variable speed one, but am hesitant now.
customer_reviews.author: Denny E Henson

customer_reviews.title: Severely out of balance and is dangerous!
customer_reviews.text: The item seems sturdy but is severely out of balance and is dangerous. It almost injured me and messed up two tools and almost a cylinder head. *USE SPEED CONTROL TO TEST BALANCE BEFORE SPINNING TO FULL SPEED!!*
customer_reviews.author: M.B.

customer_reviews.title: CHEAP
customer_reviews.text: CHEAP IMPORT GETS HOT AFTER FIVE MINUTES DO NOT BUY THIS...
customer_reviews.author: CHOPPER

customer_reviews.title: Great addition to my tool set
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to do a home project. It is a simple on off switch not variable speed I use this in place of a air grinder it’s a bit big but the unit is pretty light. I’m not grinding for hours probably 15-20 minutes at a time it has worked very well.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: this thing has made wood working a breeze
customer_reviews.text: I use this guy for carving wood, cleaning up steel it works great, it is heavy duty and don't forget to wear some protection when using it this thing will really leave a mark if you catch your hand with it!
customer_reviews.author: Aosis J.

customer_reviews.title: Cutting champion
customer_reviews.text: Works like uh champion Training for the title. It runs, yells and cuts like nobodies business in right areas. She got hot from putting her a$$ to work. But never died on me like a $50 pos. You know what I’m talking about, who has time to keep taking them back?! Overall it’s does the job
customer_reviews.author: SkyRyder

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: when compared to the harbor freight grinder this thing is a Cadillac however I would like to see a little more amperage coming out of it to have a little more power smooth-running no problems grinds metal easily has not exploded
customer_reviews.author: Big_jissum

customer_reviews.title: I would not recommend this.
customer_reviews.text: after 3 or 4 minutes of light use (sculpting wood), the body of the tool becomes so hot it burns your hand. I would not recommend this.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very nice die grinder
customer_reviews.text: Very nice die grinder. Used it on aluminum intake and heads to port match. First time I had ever used one. It was bigger than I thought! Worked perfectly. I also got the AC power variable drive thing for when using the sanding rolls.
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: My last one was good for 24 years and only had to go to ...
customer_reviews.text: My last one was good for 24 years and only had to go to tool heaven when the plastic around the nose cracked. One of my most used tools in the garage and worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: Fullboogie

customer_reviews.title: The rubber fore piece is comfortable, the on off switch is excellent
customer_reviews.text: I think this is the nicest electric die grinder I've ever used. The rubber fore piece is comfortable, the on off switch is excellent, requires a firm push to lock on, disengages easily... no accidental turn ons. My only peeve is the stamped collet wrenches are functional but thin. Unit works great with the electronic stepless controller I purchased at the same time. Very happy with this die grinder.
customer_reviews.author: J LI NY

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my husband. He circled it in a magazine at a local store. He wanted it for Christmas. Well I found it here for a few dollars cheaper. He was so happy ans said it was exactly what he wanted. Exactly as it is in stores.
customer_reviews.author: ChrisTop Contributor: Baby

customer_reviews.title: Good Tool
customer_reviews.text: Good tool. More affordable than most of the electric die grinders on the market. Lightweight. Downside is the single speed option - either on or off. Variable speed would have been nice. Other than that, good tool.
customer_reviews.author: Tanner C.

customer_reviews.title: More than I expected.
customer_reviews.text: I can handle it with one hand and hold metal with the other. In a safe manner of course. Great buy.
customer_reviews.author: Juan P. Bravo

customer_reviews.title: solid, reliable
customer_reviews.text: To be honest, I was looking for deal on the Metabo die grinder because of their reputation, but got this for less than half the price of the Metabo. It is certainly not half the grinder, when it comes to quality. It does not heat up quickly at the head, like some die grinders I have tried. The power is OK, the weight acceptable, and the balance isn't too bad.
customer_reviews.author: Noor S. Khalsa

customer_reviews.title: Another issue is that the wrench easily slips off of the very slender lower collet nut ...
customer_reviews.text: Been sculpting and fabricating for 30 years, used many electric die grinders. This is one. Motor is just strong enough, but will bog with pressure. The problem is the collet. The nuts come loose during use no matter the bit or pressure I apply when tightening. Another issue is that the wrench easily slips off of the very slender lower collet nut and becomes jammed on the threads. Just missed the window to return so I am stuck with this hassle. Look at something else.
customer_reviews.author: metalhead

customer_reviews.title: Product was exactly what I had ordered.  Fast delivery. Pleased.
customer_reviews.text: Product was exactly what I had ordered. Fast delivery. Pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Katherine

customer_reviews.title: Bigger is better
customer_reviews.text: Sweet tool. For when you need more than the Dremel. Smooth.
customer_reviews.author: Howie

customer_reviews.title: A quality name brand part
customer_reviews.text: This tool has solid construction, a good feel to the body, and good power. Mikita is known for quality tools, and this is no exception.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: 🤙🏼
customer_reviews.text: Great die grinder. Comfortable to hold, not a lot of vibrations and the ON button is pretty nice to click. 4 stars because no variable speed, but still works great for cleaning the inside of pipes before welding so it’s ok.🤘🏼
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Replaces 2 Craftsman grinders that have finally died on me ...
customer_reviews.text: Replaces 2 Craftsman grinders that have finally died on me after 20 years of use. I have always used Makita tools, and this one is exactly what I needed at an exceptionally low price, and free shipping with 2 day delivery. That cannot be beaten by anyone else.
customer_reviews.author: David Marlow

customer_reviews.title: Cowboy Dan, dont settle for a cheaper brand,get this one it's the only way to go.
customer_reviews.text: I am so glad I got the best of the best for the money , this makita with the right bits make carving logs into animals and so on. This tool will bit you if you're not carefull it grabed my glove and did not stop the motor thank god for heavy gloves.
customer_reviews.author: Hedy B.

customer_reviews.title: Its kind of like the energizer bunny
customer_reviews.text: Its a makita, what can i say. Makita priduct overall tend to be the ones i have the fewest problems with, best ergonomics for my hands anyway and tolerate a lot of abuse. This was a steal and it works and works
customer_reviews.author: Bill R.

customer_reviews.title: Awesome tool
customer_reviews.text: Love this thing. Getting a lot of use out of it.
customer_reviews.author: Tyrone Cosson

customer_reviews.title: Its OK
customer_reviews.text: Doesnt have as much power as i thought. And the tip/handle heats up pretty significantly.
customer_reviews.author: VtCollection

customer_reviews.title: Makita 1/4" electric long shaft Straight Grinder
customer_reviews.text: @ 25,000 rpm It is So Smooth it hard to Comprehend . I removed it from it's box ,Chucked up an Arbor & a Grinding Disc . Plugged it Up Dawned the Safty gear & was Amazed @ It's performance . I shopped around before Purchasing . I'm very satisfied . Thanks Makita & Amazon
customer_reviews.author: Gary Napier

customer_reviews.title: This grinder is awesome. I used it to smooth out the welds ...
customer_reviews.text: This grinder is awesome. I used it to smooth out the welds on a bronze sculpture. It's very powerful and it never bogs down. It's narrow and enables me to get in tight places. Get yourself some good tool bits and get to work. You will be very happy with this grinder.
customer_reviews.author: Okemos

customer_reviews.title: BAD SWITCH
customer_reviews.text: switch worked for one time Then would not move or turn on drill Had to return
customer_reviews.author: Jujo

customer_reviews.title: This is a good grinder and holds up to a good amount of ...
customer_reviews.text: This is a good grinder and holds up to a good amount of pressure on the tool. Would buy it again if needed
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Grinder is NOT variable speed as advertised.
customer_reviews.text: The grinder is shown in several places as a variable speed and it is NOT variable. I received it yesterday for a job on Monday and now I am stuck using it. You would think a company this large could fix that problem. This is not a new problem as I was looking back at comments and people have been tricked as I have before. In GD0601... You probably know what the GD stands for in my shop now.
customer_reviews.author: Garland McQuinn

customer_reviews.title: Get it done
customer_reviews.text: Great power to clean up holes and slots in hard to reach areas on automotive frame rails time saver
customer_reviews.author: Jesse Mejia

customer_reviews.title: the best, when this used up
customer_reviews.text: the best ,when this used up , i ll buy another , use a lot .
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Does have good power and runs very smooth
customer_reviews.text: Starts warming up after a couple minutes run time, Worried about running it much longer than 5 minutes. Does have good power and runs very smooth. Edited........ been almost 2 years now and it still works great. I do not use it all the time but when needed has yet to fail me.
customer_reviews.author: Nick Mag

customer_reviews.title: No disappointment
customer_reviews.text: Got just what i expected from Makita. Smooth, powerful and dependable. Just one speed, so just be careful and approached your work with due diligence. Tool handles nicely and has performed all tasks well.
customer_reviews.author: Jerry L. Mone

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Garbage. Used it for 2 weeks (pretty lightly) and it crapped out. You get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.author: Steven Haulenbeek

customer_reviews.title: Makita GD0601 Die Grinder see also Diverse VE on YouTube.
customer_reviews.text: Very good and easy to operate. Shipping and ordering was a snap (quick). I recommend this product to all who think they will need it. It's got 25,000RPMs without load (probably little less when you use it on something) for smooth operation over variety of items and attachments.
customer_reviews.author: DiverseVE

customer_reviews.title: Makita makes great stuff!
customer_reviews.text: Fk yeah, I'm going to be a porting machine soon! Makita makes great stuff!
customer_reviews.author: bullshtstopshere

customer_reviews.title: Works Great !
customer_reviews.text: This wonderful tool saved me from having to buy an expensive air compressor to polish brass.
customer_reviews.author: Kingfish

customer_reviews.title: Powerful
customer_reviews.text: Pretty good, put a tungsten carbide on it and it will strip metal like crazy
customer_reviews.author: Wil

customer_reviews.title: our workhorse
customer_reviews.text: we use this die grinder in our stone sculpting business. This is the replacement model for the old GEO series that were a lot smaller and slimmer. The older fit into more tight spaces and were lighter and easier to hold...we miss them.
customer_reviews.author: Don Lawler

customer_reviews.title: Make sure you buy the correct size bits.
customer_reviews.text: I liked the price. Has a nice weight, not to heavy. Works great for woodcarving. Very satisfied with this product.
customer_reviews.author: robert

customer_reviews.title: Just what I  wanted.
customer_reviews.text: It's huge compared to a pneumatic die-grinders but this one never stalls and is great for most tasks. Primarily used as a cut-off tool. Cuts as fast as a recip saw but smother and cuts angles and arcs better. Leaves a clean, ready to weld edge.

customer_reviews.title: Awesome die grinder.
customer_reviews.text: This is an awesome tool for when you don't want to bother with the air compressor and hose. Very powerful. Well made.
customer_reviews.author: ScottB

customer_reviews.title: it is a very nice tool, has performed as good as my pneumatic ...
customer_reviews.text: Have used this tool for some time now. it is a very nice tool, has performed as good as my pneumatic tools (doesn't have speed control). Very fast when used to clean large areas with the carbide burrs. Makita makes good quality products, and the price was good too.
customer_reviews.author: Gurdial

customer_reviews.title: Better than Air
customer_reviews.text: Unless you have a massive compressor, don't buy an air driven die grinder, get one of these. After many years of use and abuse, my Craftman D.G. finally bit the dust. I tried an air driven one, but a 33 gallon compressor can't keep up. So far the Makita has worked great - very strong - doesn't bog. I would have given it 5 stars, but I want to see how long it lasts. Even if I have to buy one every 2 years, it's a hell of a lot better and faster than waiting for the compressor to catch up!
customer_reviews.author: Peter P.

customer_reviews.title: Smooth operation
customer_reviews.text: Have only used a few times so far but impressed with quality and vibration-free operation
customer_reviews.author: George M.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Used this with Astro 2181 rotary burr set on brass. Exceeded my expectations.
customer_reviews.author: Mark L

customer_reviews.title: A great investment.
customer_reviews.text: It's not cheap, but it's powerful, quiet, smooth...a tool I expect to use until they put me in the ground. A great investment.
customer_reviews.author: 1969ChrisCraftRoamer46

customer_reviews.title: YES.
customer_reviews.text: Essentially a Dremel tool for full size men. It's glorious.
customer_reviews.author: MP

customer_reviews.title: Does the job well!
customer_reviews.text: Does the job well! Stick a carbide bit at the end and let it chew some metal up!
customer_reviews.author: Elton

customer_reviews.title: fantastic product, strong power and very smooth operation
customer_reviews.text: fantastic product, strong power and very smooth operation. used it with carbide bits to port intake plenum, makes short work of the plenum and in my opinion far quieter and consistent than a air powered tool
customer_reviews.author: Harkirat Sandhu

customer_reviews.title: Quality, usability.....
customer_reviews.text: Looked at several grinders and read tons of reviews. This grinder is exactly what I was looking for. Very well balanced and easy to use in small areas. Highly recommend this tool.
customer_reviews.author: Rich R

customer_reviews.title: Very nice grinder
customer_reviews.text: I didnt want to shell out for an air compressor and the grinders at Harbor Freight seem kinda crappy so i decided to pic this one up and it seems to be very well built. I dont foresee any issues out of it any time soon...
customer_reviews.author: Tim S.

customer_reviews.title: SUPERB
customer_reviews.text: This is a high quality, sturdy and powerful grinder. Of course it is. Makita just keeps making them better and better. The smaller, hand grip style front end is a great improvement over he previous model which was excellent also.
customer_reviews.author: Doug Rowell

customer_reviews.title: I've only used it once so far but it worked super great!
customer_reviews.text: This is one powerful grinder. I've only used it once so far but it worked super great!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: I'm working with bonsai trees and this is absolutely outstanding tool for my hobby! Thanks a lot. A MUST to all those people who work with big pieces of wood.
customer_reviews.author: Sarmat

customer_reviews.title: great grinder
customer_reviews.text: it is very powerful and does not get hot at all.
customer_reviews.author: Roger Giorgio

customer_reviews.title: Hopefully it will be great
customer_reviews.text: I will post a video of the this product on YouTube and put a link here so far so good
customer_reviews.author: William A.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great product but you gotta hold on tight --very powerful
customer_reviews.author: Wayne J. Lilly

customer_reviews.title: Great for Automotive Use
customer_reviews.text: Works great, especially if you do not have a large compressor to handle the high cfm required by an air-grinder. This Die-Grinder works easily with little if any strain.
customer_reviews.author: Douglas P

customer_reviews.title: have many burrs that I use daily on wood working projects and it performs like a champ
customer_reviews.text: Can not live without this tool and it has the power I need get the job done, have many burrs that I use daily on wood working projects and it performs like a champ.
customer_reviews.author: Duiane Dahler

customer_reviews.title: good tool
customer_reviews.text: rubust made, smooth operation, no vibration .. I hope it lasts long. The older model lasted 25 years of heavy usage. Highly recomended
customer_reviews.author: Georgio N.

customer_reviews.title: great die grinder
customer_reviews.text: this is a great die grinder for the money. I do wood carving and this product works great for that. It's easy to work with and plenty of power.
customer_reviews.author: mujr

customer_reviews.title: Good power and feel
customer_reviews.text: Good power and feel. It definitely seems to be of quality construction. So far I've used it to do a couple hours of porting and it held up well. My one complaint is that it doesn't even come with a cheap carrying bag.
customer_reviews.author: Atticus Sharp

customer_reviews.title: Really an excellent product
customer_reviews.text: The only reason I gave it four instead of five stars is the placement of the switch for the Bosch (a friend has it) is a bit better, so it would have to get a better rating. But the Bosch is more expensive, and this Makita lets me do some really excellent work. It's great and I recommend it highly.
customer_reviews.author: Daryl

customer_reviews.title: I lke it
customer_reviews.text: It seems to have a lot of power and is very smooth running. My only complaint is it did not come with an 1/8 Collete. I order one online that cost $10.00 (cheapest I could find).
customer_reviews.author: Donald R. Bingham

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Nice Makita quality but pretty large and heavy compaired to air die grinders.
customer_reviews.author: LUM

customer_reviews.title: Works really well, NIce tool to have and it's a Makita.
customer_reviews.text: This grinder works really well, it's a Makita, very good product plenty of power and speed we used it all day with no problems, it arrive on time like always Amazon it's great.
customer_reviews.author: ViLo

customer_reviews.title: Great tool at a great price
customer_reviews.text: Great tool at a great price. I was a little disappointed that it didn't come with wrenches. Very smooth and comfortable to use.
customer_reviews.author: Jim B.

customer_reviews.title: Great tool. seems  slightly awkward.
customer_reviews.text: This is a beast. Used a handful of times with the astro burrs, does what it's supposed to do. No complaints.
customer_reviews.author: Traci L

customer_reviews.title: Best tool in my collection.
customer_reviews.text: I was debating buying an expensive air compressor to run a die grinder. This tool is hands down amazing!! I use it to grind out welds inside Harley pipes and this tool knocks it out of the park. Easy to handle, far more quiet than air tools and more than enough power!
customer_reviews.author: Woody

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: works well but a lot bigger and heavier than the last one i had
customer_reviews.author: Mike Kyzer

customer_reviews.title: Decent die grinder
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for an unusual purpose... to mount on an automatic facer, and it is performing very well so far... It has the necessary power to grind even when a decent amount of pressure is applied. Only time will tell how it performs in the long run... it depends on how the bearings in the casing hold up to the pressure, but hopefully they will be easy to change if it comes to that, and it looks like they should be. But in the short term it is performing very well.
customer_reviews.author: A-bomb-in-a-bull

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use switch
customer_reviews.text: Very smooth and powerful. No vibrations. Well balanced. Easy to use switch.
customer_reviews.author: Gary Price

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: My husband went crazy for it and has been using it everywhere, very well made.
customer_reviews.author: Viola Koefelda

customer_reviews.title: Great Rotary Grinder
customer_reviews.text: Very effective tool,no frills.Get the silver box of bits offered too.
customer_reviews.author: Bojo

customer_reviews.title: Works for my intended purpose
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to cut out sheet metal of a car I am restoring. Works fantastic for what I bought it for. It has plenty of power and I am sure I will find more uses for it as my project continues.
customer_reviews.author: Gregory J. Marler

customer_reviews.title: ... Dewalt 1-1/2 inch grinder for years and it is great. But the Makita comes in at about half ...
customer_reviews.text: I've had a Dewalt 1-1/2 inch grinder for years and it is great. But the Makita comes in at about half the price of a Dewalt. I very well satisfied with the Makita - it is strong and seems very durable. My dad saw it and got one also - he likes it too.
customer_reviews.author: Randy McDuffie

customer_reviews.title: Super
customer_reviews.text: Everything I expect out a Makita Product. Will have to see just how long it lasts. If it is anywhere close to an old drill I had it will last me forever.
customer_reviews.author: hday2212

customer_reviews.title: As always Makita is one of the best.
customer_reviews.text: What is there to say??? As always Makita is one of the best.
customer_reviews.author: Peter Iatrou

customer_reviews.title: New favorite tool
customer_reviews.text: I never write reviews but this thing works great. Building an aluminum speed boat and this thing has been priceless. Use it with a carbide burr for back chipping, grinding and trimming pieces to fit.
customer_reviews.author: Winston Justin Davies

customer_reviews.title: A nice tool, worth the money !
customer_reviews.text: I have used Chicago Pnematic tools in the past and this tool is far superior, not even close. Very durable, lightweight, easy to use ! I would buy it again !
customer_reviews.author: Gary Wyman

customer_reviews.title: Just what I was looking for. So much easier ...
customer_reviews.text: Just what I was looking for. So much easier than dragging an air hose into a tight spot to cut a panel.
customer_reviews.author: john m

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Love it. Name brand. good quality. great price. should have included the arbor but they never do.
customer_reviews.author: R.M.

customer_reviews.title: Epic Fail
customer_reviews.text: Complete junk No way to tighten cullet onto bits. Cannot wait to return this back to Amazon!
customer_reviews.author: Jason Bosh

customer_reviews.title: powerful
customer_reviews.text: Strong, powerful, great price, not to loud , a must have if you work with metal and dont want to run the compressor
customer_reviews.author: marinemekanix

customer_reviews.title: Quality grinder, reasonable price
customer_reviews.text: Nice die grinder. Arrived well packaged and in a timely manner. Used to cut out broken keys inside of shrouded laundry coin boxes and worked great. Unit is slightly heavy, but is obviously well made and has a comfortable feel in the users hand. Unit is slightly quieter than my previous units with no compromise in speed and power. I would recommend this unit to anyone needing a decent not every day use die grinder.
customer_reviews.author: Barron

customer_reviews.title: Makita die grinder
customer_reviews.text: Website Photo and dimension 's were lacking. The tool was bigger than I'd hoped. But Makita is a good tool and I'll use this for other jobs.
customer_reviews.author: russel ready

customer_reviews.title: Makita GD0601 1/4-Inch Die Grinder
customer_reviews.text: die grinder is very smooth and quiet running. I expected it to be noisy like a router but it is not.
customer_reviews.author: FISHERMAN46

customer_reviews.title: Nice addition to collection
customer_reviews.text: This grinder was bought for its ability to run AC/DC power. I have used it for metal working in field and garage. When in field it gets powered by a Lincoln SA-200 which is DC only. In the garage I prefer this tool because it cheap to run and quiet. Hands down a pneumatic die grinder is more compact and runs cooler. But a pneumatic version comparable in power would need a large air compressor. Time will tell if Makita still holds the quality. I have 4 other Makita angle grinders that are still plugging away. So my expectation is this tool will perform well also.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Happy I purchased this! Love it
customer_reviews.text: Works great glad I bought it here everywhere else was more expensive..and didn't have to pay for shipping very satisfied
customer_reviews.author: Paul Anthony Maldonado jr

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: is a good one, but does not have "Special Features variable-speed" as they published
customer_reviews.author: Rodolfo Carrillo

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: great tool when you need to cut in thigt places
customer_reviews.author: Ed Tooley

customer_reviews.title: Great tool for porting Stainless steel exhaust manifolds
customer_reviews.text: I had an older model that lasted for about 8 years. This one is considerably bigger and beefier. Action is smooth and the weight helps to put pressure on the material for longer. I use this typically with a carbide burr to port stainless steel exhaust manifolds. Stays cool and is powerful. It also works great when cutting aluminum (pretty much a given if it works great on stainless).
customer_reviews.author: Mike Young

customer_reviews.title: It would be nice if it came in a plastic carrying case.
customer_reviews.text: This tool replaced a Craftsman 1/4" die grinder I had for a number of years. It seems rugged and gets the job done. My only complaint is that it doesn't come in a plastic carrying case like my Craftsman did and it is too big to fit in the case I have left after I tossed the failed Craftsman.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

product_meta.title: Makita GD0601 1/4" Die Grinder, with AC/DC Switch,Blue
product_meta.description:
Makita’s ¼-inch die Grinder (model GD0601) combines power and speed with motor-protection features for improved grinding performance. The GD0601 is engineered with a powerful AC/DC motor with 25, 000 RPM in a slim body design, and a conveniently located slide-switch for on/off function. This combination of power and ease-of-use features makes the GD0601 ideal for a range of grinding tasks.

AMAZON.COM
Makita's 1/4-Inch Die Grinder (model GD0601) combines power and speed with motor-protection features for improved grinding performance. The GD0601 is engineered with a powerful AC/DC motor with 25,000 rpm in a slim body design, and a conveniently located slide-switch for on/off function. This combination of power and ease-of-use features makes the GD0601 ideal for a range of grinding tasks.



3.5 AMP Motor Delivers 25,000 RPM
The GD0601 is engineered with a Makita-built industrial motor that delivers 25,000 rpm. The motor is housed with front and rear air vents to run cooler under continuous use, extending the life of the grinder. The GD0601 includes an AC/DC switch for use with alternative power sources.Motor Protection Features for Longer Tool Life
To protect the motor from debris, the grinder is built with a labyrinth construction that seals the motor and bearings by creating a complex set of channels, extending the life of the tool. In addition, the armature is sealed by a protective zig-zag varnish which prevents contamination by creating a barrier under rotation.

Comfort and Ergonomics
Makita has engineered comfort and ergonomics into the grinder for professional use all day long. The slide-switch is positioned on the small circumference barrel grip for improved handling and operation. The grinder has solid aluminum housing with a stepped-neck design, and is protected by a removable rubber boot. The front and rear air vents are engineered to keep the motor cool and blow debris away from the user for improved visibility.

Versatile Design for a Range of Applications
The GD0601 is built for a range of applications including pipe fittings and small-scale grinding. It is ideal for welders, plumbers, ship builders, automotive, HVAC, and more. The GD0601 is just another example of Makita's commitment to innovative technology and best-in-class engineering.

About Makita Grinders
Makita offers a wide range of grinders with power and protection features for industrial grinding and metalworking. Makita grinders are engineered with labyrinth construction to seal and protect the motor and bearings from contamination, and the protective zig-zag varnish seals the armature from dust and debris for longer tool life. Makita's growing line of grinders includes models ranging from a 1/4-inch die grinder to 9-inch angle grinders.

About Makita
Makita is a worldwide manufacturer of industrial quality power tools and offers a wide range of industrial accessories. Makita applies leading-edge innovation to engineer power tools that are more compact and energy efficient, yet deliver industrial strength power and results. Makita U.S.A., Inc. is located in La Mirada, California, and operates an extensive distribution network located throughout the U.S. For more information, please call 800/4-MAKITA (800/462-5482) or visit makitatools.com. Makita is Best in Class Engineering.

Warranty
Every Makita tool is thoroughly inspected and tested before leaving the factory. If you are not satisfied with any Makita tool within 30 days of purchase, return it and Makita will provide a replacement or refund. Each Makita tool is warranted to be free of defects from workmanship and materials for the period of ONE YEAR from the date of original purchase. Should any trouble develop during this one-year period, return the COMPLETE tool, freight prepaid, to one of Makita's Factory or Authorized Service Centers. Please see makitatools.com for complete details.

What's in the Box
Makita GD0601 1/4-inch Die Grinder includes: 1/4-inch collet cone and wrenches.






FROM THE MANUFACTURER
1/4" die grinder, easy to handle at only 3.5lbs with powerful 3.5 AMP motor with fast 25,000RPM.Anti-dust motor section.Solid aluminum housing with stepped neck for added durability.Vent slots designed to direct exhaust air away from the user.Round-shaped collet nut reduces the possibility of damage.Switch lever conveniently located for one hand operation.

See more

Protective zig-zag varnish seals the armature from dust and debris for longer tool life
Solid aluminum housing with stepped neck for added durability
Vent slots designed to direct exhaust air away from the user
